items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Coly, River Yarty, Umborne Brook

items.message:
Flooding is possible overnight on Tuesday and into Wednesday morning.
A band of heavy rain is forecasted during Tuesday night and Wednesday morning causing river levels to rise in the River Axe area.
Flooding to low lying land and roads close to rivers is possible from the early hours of Wednesday morning.
We expect rivers to remain high throughout Wednesday.
Take care near the areas of concern and monitor your local weather conditions.
We are constantly monitoring river levels and have staff in the area checking for and clearing blockages in this location. This message will be updated on Wednesday evening or earlier if the situation changes.

items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Plym, Tory Brook, Long Brook

items.message:
Flooding is possible during the daytime of Wednesday 3rd September and into the early hours of Thursday morning. Over the last 12 hours, we have seen heavy rain and river levels in the River Plym and Tory Brook have started to rise. Further heavy rain and thunderstorms are forecast today from midday until this evening, with totals expected of up to 25mm. Forecast levels suggest there could be flooding to low lying land and roads close to the rivers. We expect the rivers to remain high. 

Take care near the areas of concern and monitor your local weather conditions. We are monitoring river levels and have staff in the area checking for and clearing blockages. This message will be updated on by midday on Thursday or earlier if the situation changes.

items.description: Scrase Bridge and West Common Streams

floodArea.riverOrSea: Scrase Bridge Stream, West Common Stream

items.message: The Scrase Bridge and West Common Streams are high and rising. 15mm of rain has been recorded at Haywards Heath in the last two hours. From 13:30 minor flooding could affect a small number of commercial properties on Bridge Road and residential properties on West Common Road. Minor flooding could affect properties near the Witch Inn, along Hickmans Lane and Blackthorns. Odd numbered properties from 29 to 47 on Meadow Drive could be affected by flooding. A further 5-10mm of rain is possible over the next 6 hours. The river should begin to fall by 14:30 on 03/09/2025, and return to normal from 16:00. Flood impacts should ease as river levels fall. There is 10-20mm of rainfall possible tomorrow, Thursday 04/09/2025. If you see a blockage affecting the flow in the river on Bridge Road or Hickmans Lane, please call our incident hotline on 0800 80 70 60. We are clearing debris from grilles through Lindfield, including the Builders Centre and Witch Inn, to help keep the river flowing freely and reduce flood risk. We will update this message by 19:00 03/09/2025.
